info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 1:45PM CDT until August 03 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN KENDALL...NORTHWESTERN WILL...SOUTHEASTERN KANE AND SOUTHWESTERN DUPAGE COUNTIES... At 145 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Oswego, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Aurora, Naperville, Bolingbrook, Wheaton, Romeoville, Plainfield, Woodridge, Oswego, Homer Glen, Lisle, Darien, Montgomery, Warrenville and Boulder Hill. This includes... Benedictine University and North Central College. Including the following interstates... I-55 between mile markers 259 and 270. I-88 between mile markers 125 and 129. I-355 between mile markers 11 and 15. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
